body.directions: Read each word or phrase in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: On which of the following do you most likely find the item indicated by the word presented?
body.correct: Job wonderfully done, especially recognizing the characters in the choices without the assistance of pinyin. Awesome! 帘子 liánzi means curtain, and you can easily find it on a window, but maybe not on a cat!
body.incorrect: Very close. Think about the meaning of the word, and then read the words in the choices to identify their meanings and consider which one can match the word presented the most.

body.quiz: Which of the following items best matches the item indicated by the word presented?
body.answer: Audio for 书桌 shūzhuō (desk)
options: Audio for 帘子 liánzi (curtain)
Audio for 门 mén (door)
Audio for 床 chuáng (bed)
body.correct: Fabulous job! 椅子 yǐzi means “chair,” and the best furniture item to match with it would be 书桌 shūzhuō (desk). It would be awkward having a curtain on the chair, wouldn’t it?
body.incorrect: Not quite…first identify the meaning of the word, and then listen to the audios in the choices to identify their meanings as well. Then match them one by one to see which one suits the best.

body.quiz: Which of the following is an antonym (word with opposite meaning) of the word presented?
body.correct: You got it! Another excellent job recognizing the words in the choices without the assistance of pinyin. 上边 shàngbiān means “on top,” and the opposite of it would be 下边 xiàbiān (on bottom/under).
body.incorrect: So close! Think about the meaning of this word and what its opposite should be. Then check the four words in the choices to see which one suits the best.
